replies.body:
Out of all the non-Korean teams TSM really does have the best chances of getting out of groups. Team WE doesn't stand a chance sadly and Gambit is just a bit behind TSM given Besty has 0 international experience.

Everyone else? Not so lucky. SK and C9 will be slaughtering each other and any fan who looks at things logically without patriotism running through their veins will say the 2 teams are very evenly matched. It can go either way.

I agree, ranking SK above TSM is idiotic. SK's only strategy this LCS split has been to pick winning matchups for every lane and then fast push turrets in every lane and have Svenskeren invade the enemy jungle. This brute-force method won't work vs strategically sound teams like C9, TSM, the Korean teams, etc.

Strategically sound... C9's pick zed to usually win is a pretty sound strategy I guess... There is no hope of counter play SK will just crumble to the zed pick... Oh wait what happens if they ban zed lol

Not to mention that C9's rotations even threw samsung white for a loop in game 4 of their quarter final at worlds when C9 were behind... Yes they lost eventually but that was to a team who only GE tigers can be compared to in this competition.
Samsung Blue*

Then C9 pick kennen mid, or liss mid, or something hai hasn't revealed yet. Hai can play other stuff besides zed, they will just always pick zed if it is up because it is one of the strongest mid-lane picks right now.

They don't just pick zed because he's a good pick it's because that's what hai usually do well on. With lissandra and kennen either ban them out or ban kennen and first pick lissandra. Look then and see hai go back to what he's done at in solo queue just like at worlds with the talon picks
TSM strategically sound? The only tactic they use is get Bjergsen rolling. The SK strategy isn't living or dying on one man unlike C9 (meteos) or TSM (Bjergsen). Same goes for Gambit and Diamond.

...except there certainly are games when TSM doesn't try to get Bjerg rolling... he does it on his own. IIRC, Bjerg solo'd XWX in the first TSM v. TIP match, no need for the rest of the team to camp mid. They can win w/o needing Santorin babysitting.

Not only that, but look at how many times teams have tried to 3v1 gank Dyrus, to varying degrees of short-term success. What is TSM supposed to do in that case, sit around doing nothing? No.. they go gank another lane (usually bottom) or shove one of the other turrets. And I do mean "short-term" success of ganking Dyrus, because you can't keep him down. He never tilts. Doesn't matter if he's something like 1/4/2 at the 25 min mark. He somehow always manages to get the items he needs to soak up the damage for Bjerg/Turtle.
i see the salt from u when TSM loses to WE lol. it might happens, dont forget CHINA is WAY too STRONG COMPARE TO NA. thats true
Didn't TSM take a game off of the world runner up Chinese team last split with arguably less synergy? I'm not counting WE out, I am just saying being Chinese doesn't make them Godlike

Godlike is Chinese, but all Chinese aren't Godlike
See what I did there? ... no?...

Team WE is in the bottom of the CN region standing (Only Energy Pacemaker is. 

The only reason they are going is because they had a half way decent team during IEM Shenzhen (All Chinese Team Event with OMG, IG, EDG and WE). Now they only have Spirit in jungle and he can't carry all of their dead weight.
lmao you have know idea what you are talking about lmao
Atleast he can be taken more seriously than someone with a name like yours.

As a Chinese who do not really follow EU LCS, I am so curious to ask. How does EU audience rank LPL teams?

Sure WE is in last place of LPL, but it does not mean WE is worse than EU/NA teams, so based on what do you think WE does not stand a chance?

It is not just that, WE is playing with 2 new substitutes. So likely the team synergy won't be that great as well. WE is playing against No.1-4 from every other region, and other regions aren't that behind Chinese region. Consider all these factors, WE didn't seem to stand a chance against these teams. 

WE is performing way above the expectations. And now they just beat GE tigers. Really can't blame the experts here, I don't think anyone would expect this to happen.

To be honest, pre-tourny power rankings are all opinion. If we just did things based on historic performance WE *wouldn't* stand a chance. Neither would any non-korean team.... But in the case of "last place vs 1st/2nd, etc" it's laughable to propose that WE is even comparable to the other members of this tournament.

I'm aware things turned out rather differently than was expected(which I am happy about tbh), but I just find it insulting(to a region) that someone would even attempt to argue that a last place team should be ranked higher than other top teams because "our region is just so much better".
WE is in the finals. GG good thing the tigers actualy suck
underestimate gambit more pls... we will see who will DOMOI first

> underestimate gambit more pls

...and then Gambit goes 0-2, losing to one of the lowest ranked teams in China, who's playing with 2 subs...

Nope, I'm pretty sure they were ranked appropriately, as one of the 2 worst teams at the IEM Championships this year.

See, what everyone failed to notice is that, while the Gambit organization AS A WHOLE has performed well at past IEMs, THIS CURRENT VERSION of Gambit is ***nowhere*** near as strong as past incarnations.

And then this low-ranked Chinese team will naturally get blown up when they play CJ Entus, right?

Funny how it goes. Well, I hope TSM gets to show western teams aren´t all bad.

Based on WE"s preparation, they are not suppose to win.  But the fact that they made it to finally already proves enough.

I follow LPL, so I know what happened with WE. Before IEM, there was an interview with "Yuzhe", the support from WE. He cried during that interview, and said "WE lost so many LPL games, so he does not even know how to play the game anymore". 
It is already enough for them, and hope they will gain confidence through this IEM, and successfully stay in LPL.
meanwhile we in finals
I can't wait to see C9 vs SK. It will be a great game, if zed isn't banned.
Love how it never happened might need to say free9 now instead of freesm or freelg
Madlife may not be the god he once was, but i'm SUPER excited to see him on the international stage again!!! Also super excited that his first match will be against his old European rival Eddy :D
{{champion:412}}  v {{champion:53}} pl0x

Gambit and C9 are underrated in this ranking. They both had bad starts to the season but that will have 0 impact on how they play in this tournament. Diamond is killing it right now and this is a IEM tournament. I would be surprised if they didn't make it out of groups even if some people would rate other teams above them. C9 has the best shotcalling and teamplay in Na by far, they will get crushed by GE Tigers but they will have a chance against SK. If SK wins the first game they will have to play GE Tigers aswell and they will also get crushed so in the end it will come down to SK vs C9 and SK has shown problems with vision and strategy. Putting Gambit at 7th out of 8 at a IEM tournament is almost blasphemy seriously, I hope they get to the finals now .
Welp, now that both have 0-2'ed out of the tournament, I guess the power rankings are more accurate than a lot of people on here gave them credit for.

Except all of their rankings were about 3-4 places off: WE getting 2nd instead of 8th, TSM getting 1st not 4th, GE getting 3rd, not 1st, SK getting 6th, not 3rd, CJ getting 5th, not 2nd, and the rest are 1 place off.
C9 beating GE would be a pretty epic upset. I beleive in you, bot lane!
Best of one format does give a higher possibility for upsets, so it's not quite set in stone what'll happen.
Hilarious how wrong these power rankings turned out to be. 8, 5th and 4th place all making the semifinals. And 2nd and 3rd failing to do so.
How is it decided who goes to this tournament? While I like Gambit, H2K and Fnatic are showing up much more than Gambit is.

I was just asking myself the same question... This is the first IEM since I started playing so I have no idea how teams get to join. Honestly I believe if any EU team deserves a spot (other than SK) is Fnatic. But that may just be the incompetence about IEM talking.

The participants in this event are decided by the winners of the various IEM events throughout the past months, and the rankings during the current season (LCS and LCK). 

The other IEM events feature teams that were invited into the tournament either by ranking, fanvote or wildcard. (For example, during IEM San Jose, TSM and Alliance [now Elements] were invited as the top teams from the prior LCS season, UOL and C9 were invited by fanvote, and Lyon and Pain Gaming were invited from outside qualifiers.) 
Team WE, Cloud9, Gambit and yoe-Flash Wolves were the winners of IEM Shenzhen, San Jose, Cologne and Taipei respectively. 

To answer your question, during IEM Cologne, Fnatic and Curse (now Liquid) were invited, but could not participate because of their incomplete rosters. At the time, Fnatic lost xPeke, Cyanide, and Rekkles so had to decline since they had no replacements. h2k was not an LCS team at the time of the previous IEM events, and, as you probably know, aren't first place, so they were not invited.

Hope that helped. (:
NOW THE LAST TEAM WE defeat no.1 team in this ranking and LCK
funny how team WE was ranked last and they are in the finals hehe...
WE #8. INDEED 8>2 & 8>1

That moment when TSM beats CJ Entus 
NA can actually win games
That awkward moment when TSM completely dicks on CJ Entus
TSM

I know TSM is both the most loved team and the most hated team (in the world most likely). But honestly the casters, analysts and the judges behind the rankings for this and the weekly top 20 need to stop showing their bias as it is very unprofessional. We all know TSM isn't the strongest team in the world, that is just a fact, but I've noticed at this point that whenever TSM is the topic of discussion the way the analysts, casters, judges etc speak is always more of a "The opponent screwed up". Where as for any other team naturally its "The team took advantage of a small opening given and won."

I'm not saying TSM should be ranked higher, their rank in this list and the top 20 in the world is usually close to correct but it just seems like the people who shouldn't be showing any bias, are jumping on the anti-TSM train. Let them be, yeah they drop the ball internationally who cares at the end of the day it should have been noted that "TSM took advantage of a screw up on Samsung Whites part." instead of "The opponent let TSM win."

GE will probably win this, I just hope C9,TSM or SK Gaming can take 2nd place from CJ Entus so people can start taking the other regions a little bit seriously instead of assuming #1 in EU,LMS or NA is equivalent to 7th place in LCK.

But anyways if C9, TSM or SK take 2nd it will be recorded as "CJ threw the game".

The match they are referencing here (TSM vs. Samsung White Game 3 at 2014 Worlds) was definitely a disrespect move from White against TSM, and TSM did take advantage. I am not saying TSM was a bad team, but White was easily the most superior team at Worlds last year. They intentionally picked a weak team composition because they thought they could close out the series against TSM even with that comp, and it is to TSM's credit that they didn't allow that. It should also be noted that this was the only loss White took during the whole Championship, and I would say it was mostly due to pride. As the scene from The Patriot goes: 

"We need to find a weakness. What are our enemies weaknesses?"
[Silence]
"They are better disciplined, better armed, and better commanded."
"Aye, and proud."
"Pride. Pride is a weakness."
"I'd prefer stupidity."
"I'll take pride."

> It should also be noted that this was the only loss White took during the whole Championship

White also dropped a game to SHRC in the finals, White won 3-1.

Although, for as many people whining that Group B was the weakest of the 4 groups last year, that group was the ONLY one that managed to defeat White. (They went 6-0 against Group A in group stage, and swept Blue [from Group C] in the semis).

> But anyways if C9, TSM or SK take 2nd it will be recorded as "CJ threw the game".

"CJ didn't have the best performance, but they have plenty of time to gear up for Worlds later this year". "CJ is only 3rd in Korea, SKT would have easily beaten any other non-Korean team". And my favorite for when it happens: "(TSM/some Chinese team) needed to bring Koreans onto their team in order to derail the Korean Hype Train, and thus Korea still wins".

/sarcasm
That's pretty much any match-up involving a NA team vs any other region. It isn't just TSM. It's an anti-NA train.

The only thing I don't like is Tencent not adjusting the schedule to adjust for another LPL team to get there.  I know the LPL plays 5000 Bo2s during the season so they can't just adjust the whole schedule, but WE is most likely going to get embarrassed.  Caomei and WeiXiao were still on the team when they won in Shenzhen.

Having EDG / OMG at this tournament would have been amazing!
If TSM can get Wildturtle to position as well as Bjergsen can then my vote is for TSM.  Other than that it looks like it'll be a Korean pubstomp boys!!
